item.title: Percentiles aggregation
item.description: Percentiles aggregation # A multi-value metrics aggregation that calculates one or more percentiles over numeric values extracted from the aggregated documents. Percentiles show the point at which a certain percentage of observed values occur. For example, the 95th percentile is the value which is greater than 95% of the observed values. Percentiles are often used to find outliers. In normal distributions, the 0.13th and 99.87th percentiles represents three standard deviations from the mean.
